title: Poster, International Design Center Nagoya: Yokoo, late 20th century
signed: Imprinted in red, bottom edge: "Designed by Tadanori Yokoo in collaboration with Toppan Printing Co., Ltd. Takeo Co., Ltd."
inscribed: Imprinted in red, top: logo (bird in profile) "IdcN International Design Center Nagoya" followed by Japanese characters.
description: Reproduction of ancient Japanese landscape painting in orange tones with temple (center left), foliage throughout framed by black outline.  Computer generated green vines superimposed over landscape painting.  Vines placed symmetrically.  Image of gazebo with golden dome in Byzantine style architecture with marble statue inside superimposed on landscape at upper center.  Two angelic women in white dress rest on vine, framing the central image of gazebo.  Computer generated concentric circles resembling whirlpool of water with cartoon-like Japanese man swimming away from shark at lower center.  Small image of woman in white dress at top right of shark superimposed on landscape.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, International Design Center Nagoya: Yokoo, late 20th century. Offset lithograph on white paper. 
Gift of Unknown Donor. 1996-129-8
